subject: RE: [junit] using multiple assers in one single test method
msgSnippet: If I understood u correctly, u can use the overload of assert() which takes in a string. assertEquals(description, expected, actual) etc. Append ur for-index
messageBody:
If I understood u correctly, u can use the overload of assert() which takes
in a string.
assertEquals(description, expected, actual) etc.
Append ur for-index to the description string.
When an assert fails, this description appears. Hope this answers ur query.


-----Original Message-----
From: manas p [mailto:junit_manas@...]
Sent: Thursday, December 11, 2003 09:42
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] using multiple assers in one single test method



Hi All,

I'm reading multiple rows from excel sheet and compare it with DB.For
comparison two resuts i'm using junit. It will iterate through a for loop
and in for loop i've assert method.But It takes all the assert methods as a
single test.I know it is recommended to use one test method for testing one
case. But i want a report to be displyed saying which comparison method is
failed .How many comparisions are done ? can anybody please help me
regarding this?Thanks in advance

Regards

mrp
